23#include <inttypes.h>

30#include <sys/epoll.h>
31#endif

33#include <isc/platform.h>
34#include <isc/app.h>
35#include <isc/condition.h>
36#include <isc/mem.h>
37#include <isc/mutex.h>
38#include <isc/event.h>
39#include <isc/platform.h>
40#include <isc/strerr.h>
41#include <isc/string.h>
42#include <isc/task.h>
43#include <isc/time.h>
44#include <isc/util.h>

46#include <pthread.h>
47
48/*%
49 * For BIND9 internal applications built with threads, we use a single app
50 * context and let multiple worker, I/O, timer threads do actual jobs.
51 * For other cases (including BIND9 built without threads) an app context acts
52 * as an event loop dispatching various events.
53 */
54static pthread_t blockedthread;
55static bool is_running;
56
57/*
58 * The application context of this module. This implementation actually
59 * doesn't use it. (This may change in the future).
60 */
61#define APPCTX_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('A', 'p', 'c', 'x')
62#define VALID_APPCTX(c) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(c, APPCTX_MAGIC)
63
64typedef struct isc__appctx {
65 isc_appctx_t common;
66 isc_mem_t *mctx;
67 isc_mutex_t lock;
68 isc_eventlist_t on_run;
69 bool shutdown_requested;
70 bool running;
71
72 /*!
73 * We assume that 'want_shutdown' can be read and written atomically.
74 */
75 bool want_shutdown;
76 /*
77 * We assume that 'want_reload' can be read and written atomically.
78 */
79 bool want_reload;
80
81 bool blocked;
82
83 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr;
84 isc_socketmgr_t *socketmgr;
85 isc_timermgr_t *timermgr;
86 isc_mutex_t readylock;
87 isc_condition_t ready;
88} isc__appctx_t;
89
90static isc__appctx_t isc_g_appctx;
91
92#ifndef HAVE_SIGWAIT
93static void
94exit_action(int arg) {
95 UNUSED(arg);
96 isc_g_appctx.want_shutdown = true;
97}
98
99static void
100reload_action(int arg) {
101 UNUSED(arg);
102 isc_g_appctx.want_reload = true;
103}
104#endif
105
106static isc_result_t
107handle_signal(int sig, void (*handler)(int)) {
108 struct sigaction sa;
109 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
110
111 memset(&sa, 0, sizeof(sa));
112 sa.sa_handler = handler;
113
114 if (sigfillset(&sa.sa_mask) != 0 ||
115 sigaction(sig, &sa, NULL) < 0) {
116 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
117 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
118 "handle_signal() %d setup: %s",
119 sig, strbuf);
120 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
121 }
122
123 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
124}
125
126isc_result_t
127isc_app_ctxstart(isc_appctx_t *ctx0) {
128 isc__appctx_t *ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)ctx0;
129 isc_result_t result;
130 int presult;
131 sigset_t sset;
132 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
133
134 REQUIRE(VALID_APPCTX(ctx));
135
136 /*
137 * Start an ISC library application.
138 */
139
140 isc_mutex_init(&ctx->readylock);
141
142 isc_condition_init(&ctx->ready);
143
144 isc_mutex_init(&ctx->lock);
145
146 ISC_LIST_INIT(ctx->on_run);
147
148 ctx->shutdown_requested = false;
149 ctx->running = false;
150 ctx->want_shutdown = false;
151 ctx->want_reload = false;
152 ctx->blocked = false;
153
154#ifndef HAVE_SIGWAIT
155 /*
156 * Install do-nothing handlers for SIGINT and SIGTERM.
157 *
158 * We install them now because BSDI 3.1 won't block
159 * the default actions, regardless of what we do with
160 * pthread_sigmask().
161 */
162 result = handle_signal(SIGINT, exit_action);
163 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
164 goto cleanup;
165 result = handle_signal(SIGTERM, exit_action);
166 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
167 goto cleanup;
168#endif
169
170 /*
171 * Always ignore SIGPIPE.
172 */
173 result = handle_signal(SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
174 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
175 goto cleanup;
176
177 /*
178 * On Solaris 2, delivery of a signal whose action is SIG_IGN
179 * will not cause sigwait() to return. We may have inherited
180 * unexpected actions for SIGHUP, SIGINT, and SIGTERM from our parent
181 * process (e.g, Solaris cron). Set an action of SIG_DFL to make
182 * sure sigwait() works as expected. Only do this for SIGTERM and
183 * SIGINT if we don't have sigwait(), since a different handler is
184 * installed above.
185 */
186 result = handle_signal(SIGHUP, SIG_DFL);
187 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
188 goto cleanup;
189
190#ifdef HAVE_SIGWAIT
191 result = handle_signal(SIGTERM, SIG_DFL);
192 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
193 goto cleanup;
194 result = handle_signal(SIGINT, SIG_DFL);
195 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
196 goto cleanup;
197#endif
198
199 /*
200 * Block SIGHUP, SIGINT, SIGTERM.
201 *
202 * If isc_app_start() is called from the main thread before any other
203 * threads have been created, then the pthread_sigmask() call below
204 * will result in all threads having SIGHUP, SIGINT and SIGTERM
205 * blocked by default, ensuring that only the thread that calls
206 * sigwait() for them will get those signals.
207 */
208 if (sigemptyset(&sset) != 0 ||
209 sigaddset(&sset, SIGHUP) != 0 ||
210 sigaddset(&sset, SIGINT) != 0 ||
211 sigaddset(&sset, SIGTERM) != 0) {
212 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
213 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
214 "isc_app_start() sigsetops: %s", strbuf);
215 result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
216 goto cleanup;
217 }
218 presult = pthread_sigmask(SIG_BLOCK, &sset, NULL);
219 if (presult != 0) {
220 strerror_r(presult, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
221 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
222 "isc_app_start() pthread_sigmask: %s",
223 strbuf);
224 result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
225 goto cleanup;
226 }
227
228 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
229
230 cleanup:
231 (void)isc_condition_destroy(&ctx->ready);
232 (void)isc_mutex_destroy(&ctx->readylock);
233 return (result);
234}
235
236isc_result_t
237isc_app_start(void) {
238 isc_g_appctx.common.impmagic = APPCTX_MAGIC;
239 isc_g_appctx.common.magic = ISCAPI_APPCTX_MAGIC;
240 isc_g_appctx.mctx = NULL;
241 /* The remaining members will be initialized in ctxstart() */
242
243 return (isc_app_ctxstart((isc_appctx_t *)&isc_g_appctx));
244}
245
246isc_result_t
247isc_app_onrun(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action,
248 void *arg)
249{
250 return (isc_app_ctxonrun((isc_appctx_t *)&isc_g_appctx, mctx,
251 task, action, arg));
252}
253
254isc_result_t
255isc_app_ctxonrun(isc_appctx_t *ctx0, isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_task_t *task,
256 isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg)
257{
258 isc__appctx_t *ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)ctx0;
259 isc_event_t *event;
260 isc_task_t *cloned_task = NULL;
261 isc_result_t result;
262
263 LOCK(&ctx->lock);
264
265 if (ctx->running) {
266 result = ISC_R_ALREADYRUNNING;
267 goto unlock;
268 }
269
270 /*
271 * Note that we store the task to which we're going to send the event
272 * in the event's "sender" field.
273 */
274 isc_task_attach(task, &cloned_task);
275 event = isc_event_allocate(mctx, cloned_task, ISC_APPEVENT_SHUTDOWN,
276 action, arg, sizeof(*event));
277 if (event == NULL) {
278 isc_task_detach(&cloned_task);
279 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
280 goto unlock;
281 }
282
283 ISC_LIST_APPEND(ctx->on_run, event, ev_link);
284
285 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
286
287 unlock:
288 UNLOCK(&ctx->lock);
289
290 return (result);
291}
292
293isc_result_t
294isc_app_ctxrun(isc_appctx_t *ctx0) {
295 isc__appctx_t *ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)ctx0;
296 int result;
297 isc_event_t *event, *next_event;
298 isc_task_t *task;
299 sigset_t sset;
300 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
301#ifdef HAVE_SIGWAIT
302 int sig;
303#endif /* HAVE_SIGWAIT */
304
305 REQUIRE(VALID_APPCTX(ctx));
306
307 LOCK(&ctx->lock);
308
309 if (!ctx->running) {
310 ctx->running = true;
311
312 /*
313 * Post any on-run events (in FIFO order).
314 */
315 for (event = ISC_LIST_HEAD(ctx->on_run);
316 event != NULL;
317 event = next_event) {
318 next_event = ISC_LIST_NEXT(event, ev_link);
319 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(ctx->on_run, event, ev_link);
320 task = event->ev_sender;
321 event->ev_sender = NULL;
322 isc_task_sendanddetach(&task, &event);
323 }
324
325 }
326
327 UNLOCK(&ctx->lock);
328
329 /*
330 * BIND9 internal tools using multiple contexts do not
331 * rely on signal.
332 */
333 if (isc_bind9 && ctx != &isc_g_appctx)
334 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
335
336 /*
337 * There is no danger if isc_app_shutdown() is called before we
338 * wait for signals. Signals are blocked, so any such signal will
339 * simply be made pending and we will get it when we call
340 * sigwait().
341 */
342 while (!ctx->want_shutdown) {
343#ifdef HAVE_SIGWAIT
344 if (isc_bind9) {
345 /*
346 * BIND9 internal; single context:
347 * Wait for SIGHUP, SIGINT, or SIGTERM.
348 */
349 if (sigemptyset(&sset) != 0 ||
350 sigaddset(&sset, SIGHUP) != 0 ||
351 sigaddset(&sset, SIGINT) != 0 ||
352 sigaddset(&sset, SIGTERM) != 0) {
353 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
354 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
355 "isc_app_run() sigsetops: %s",
356 strbuf);
357 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
358 }
359
360 result = sigwait(&sset, &sig);
361 if (result == 0) {
362 if (sig == SIGINT || sig == SIGTERM)
363 ctx->want_shutdown = true;
364 else if (sig == SIGHUP)
365 ctx->want_reload = true;
366 }
367
368 } else {
369 /*
370 * External, or BIND9 using multiple contexts:
371 * wait until woken up.
372 */
373 LOCK(&ctx->readylock);
374 if (ctx->want_shutdown) {
375 /* shutdown() won the race. */
376 UNLOCK(&ctx->readylock);
377 break;
378 }
379 if (!ctx->want_reload)
380 WAIT(&ctx->ready, &ctx->readylock);
381 UNLOCK(&ctx->readylock);
382 }
383#else /* Don't have sigwait(). */
384 if (isc_bind9) {
385 /*
386 * BIND9 internal; single context:
387 * Install a signal handler for SIGHUP, then wait for
388 * all signals.
389 */
390 result = handle_signal(SIGHUP, reload_action);
391 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
392 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
393
394 if (sigemptyset(&sset) != 0) {
395 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
396 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
397 "isc_app_run() sigsetops: %s",
398 strbuf);
399 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
400 }
401#ifdef HAVE_GPERFTOOLS_PROFILER
402 if (sigaddset(&sset, SIGALRM) != 0) {
403 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
404 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
405 "isc_app_run() sigsetops: %s",
406 strbuf);
407 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
408 }
409#endif
410 (void)sigsuspend(&sset);
411 } else {
412 /*
413 * External, or BIND9 using multiple contexts:
414 * wait until woken up.
415 */
416 LOCK(&ctx->readylock);
417 if (ctx->want_shutdown) {
418 /* shutdown() won the race. */
419 UNLOCK(&ctx->readylock);
420 break;
421 }
422 if (!ctx->want_reload)
423 WAIT(&ctx->ready, &ctx->readylock);
424 UNLOCK(&ctx->readylock);
425 }
426#endif /* HAVE_SIGWAIT */
427
428 if (ctx->want_reload) {
429 ctx->want_reload = false;
430 return (ISC_R_RELOAD);
431 }
432
433 if (ctx->want_shutdown && ctx->blocked)
434 exit(1);
435 }
436
437 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
438}
439
440isc_result_t
441isc_app_run(void) {
442 isc_result_t result;
443
444 is_running = true;
445 result = isc_app_ctxrun((isc_appctx_t *)&isc_g_appctx);
446 is_running = false;
447
448 return (result);
449}
450
451bool
452isc_app_isrunning() {
453 return (is_running);
454}
455
456isc_result_t
457isc_app_ctxshutdown(isc_appctx_t *ctx0) {
458 isc__appctx_t *ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)ctx0;
459 bool want_kill = true;
460 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
461
462 REQUIRE(VALID_APPCTX(ctx));
463
464 LOCK(&ctx->lock);
465
466 REQUIRE(ctx->running);
467
468 if (ctx->shutdown_requested)
469 want_kill = false;
470 else
471 ctx->shutdown_requested = true;
472
473 UNLOCK(&ctx->lock);
474
475 if (want_kill) {
476 if (isc_bind9 && ctx != &isc_g_appctx)
477 /* BIND9 internal, but using multiple contexts */
478 ctx->want_shutdown = true;
479 else {
480 if (isc_bind9) {
481 /* BIND9 internal, single context */
482 if (kill(getpid(), SIGTERM) < 0) {
483 strerror_r(errno,
484 strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
485 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
486 "isc_app_shutdown() "
487 "kill: %s", strbuf);
488 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
489 }
490 }
491 else {
492 /* External, multiple contexts */
493 LOCK(&ctx->readylock);
494 ctx->want_shutdown = true;
495 UNLOCK(&ctx->readylock);
496 SIGNAL(&ctx->ready);
497 }
498 }
499 }
500
501 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
502}
503
504isc_result_t
505isc_app_shutdown(void) {
506 return (isc_app_ctxshutdown((isc_appctx_t *)&isc_g_appctx));
507}
508
509isc_result_t
510isc_app_ctxsuspend(isc_appctx_t *ctx0) {
511 isc__appctx_t *ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)ctx0;
512 bool want_kill = true;
513 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
514
515 REQUIRE(VALID_APPCTX(ctx));
516
517 LOCK(&ctx->lock);
518
519 REQUIRE(ctx->running);
520
521 /*
522 * Don't send the reload signal if we're shutting down.
523 */
524 if (ctx->shutdown_requested)
525 want_kill = false;
526
527 UNLOCK(&ctx->lock);
528
529 if (want_kill) {
530 if (isc_bind9 && ctx != &isc_g_appctx)
531 /* BIND9 internal, but using multiple contexts */
532 ctx->want_reload = true;
533 else {
534 ctx->want_reload = true;
535 if (isc_bind9) {
536 /* BIND9 internal, single context */
537 if (kill(getpid(), SIGHUP) < 0) {
538 strerror_r(errno,
539 strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
540 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
541 "isc_app_reload() "
542 "kill: %s", strbuf);
543 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
544 }
545 }
546 else {
547 /* External, multiple contexts */
548 LOCK(&ctx->readylock);
549 ctx->want_reload = true;
550 UNLOCK(&ctx->readylock);
551 SIGNAL(&ctx->ready);
552 }
553 }
554 }
555
556 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
557}
558
559isc_result_t
560isc_app_reload(void) {
561 return (isc_app_ctxsuspend((isc_appctx_t *)&isc_g_appctx));
562}
563
564void
565isc_app_ctxfinish(isc_appctx_t *ctx0) {
566 isc__appctx_t *ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)ctx0;
567
568 REQUIRE(VALID_APPCTX(ctx));
569
570 isc_mutex_destroy(&ctx->lock);
571}
572
573void
574isc_app_finish(void) {
575 isc_app_ctxfinish((isc_appctx_t *)&isc_g_appctx);
576}
577
578void
579isc_app_block(void) {
580 sigset_t sset;
581 REQUIRE(isc_g_appctx.running);
582 REQUIRE(!isc_g_appctx.blocked);
583
584 isc_g_appctx.blocked = true;
585 blockedthread = pthread_self();
586 RUNTIME_CHECK(sigemptyset(&sset) == 0 &&
587 sigaddset(&sset, SIGINT) == 0 &&
588 sigaddset(&sset, SIGTERM) == 0);
589 RUNTIME_CHECK(pthread_sigmask(SIG_UNBLOCK, &sset, NULL) == 0);
590}
591
592void
593isc_app_unblock(void) {
594 sigset_t sset;
595
596 REQUIRE(isc_g_appctx.running);
597 REQUIRE(isc_g_appctx.blocked);
598
599 isc_g_appctx.blocked = false;
600
601 REQUIRE(blockedthread == pthread_self());
602
603 RUNTIME_CHECK(sigemptyset(&sset) == 0 &&
604 sigaddset(&sset, SIGINT) == 0 &&
605 sigaddset(&sset, SIGTERM) == 0);
606 RUNTIME_CHECK(pthread_sigmask(SIG_BLOCK, &sset, NULL) == 0);
607}
608
609isc_result_t
610isc_appctx_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_appctx_t **ctxp) {
611 isc__appctx_t *ctx;
612
613 REQUIRE(mctx != NULL);
614 REQUIRE(ctxp != NULL && *ctxp == NULL);
615
616 ctx = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*ctx));
617 if (ctx == NULL)
618 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
619
620 ctx->common.impmagic = APPCTX_MAGIC;
621 ctx->common.magic = ISCAPI_APPCTX_MAGIC;
622
623 ctx->mctx = NULL;
624 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &ctx->mctx);
625
626 ctx->taskmgr = NULL;
627 ctx->socketmgr = NULL;
628 ctx->timermgr = NULL;
629
630 *ctxp = (isc_appctx_t *)ctx;
631
632 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
633}
634
635void
636isc_appctx_destroy(isc_appctx_t **ctxp) {
637 isc__appctx_t *ctx;
638
639 REQUIRE(ctxp != NULL);
640 ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)*ctxp;
641 REQUIRE(VALID_APPCTX(ctx));
642
643 isc_mem_putanddetach(&ctx->mctx, ctx, sizeof(*ctx));
644
645 *ctxp = NULL;
646}
647
648void
649isc_appctx_settaskmgr(isc_appctx_t *ctx0, isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr) {
650 isc__appctx_t *ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)ctx0;
651
652 REQUIRE(VALID_APPCTX(ctx));
653
654 ctx->taskmgr = taskmgr;
655}
656
657void
658isc_appctx_setsocketmgr(isc_appctx_t *ctx0, isc_socketmgr_t *socketmgr) {
659 isc__appctx_t *ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)ctx0;
660
661 REQUIRE(VALID_APPCTX(ctx));
662
663 ctx->socketmgr = socketmgr;
664}
665
666void
667isc_appctx_settimermgr(isc_appctx_t *ctx0, isc_timermgr_t *timermgr) {
668 isc__appctx_t *ctx = (isc__appctx_t *)ctx0;
669
670 REQUIRE(VALID_APPCTX(ctx));
671
672 ctx->timermgr = timermgr;
673}
